instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.Q7010: What is Q7010? Q7010 controls whether or not PPDCIN_G3H will be let through to the PP3V42_G3H power supply, often this circuit area is not working because D7010 has died or corroded. .
definitions.Q7180: What is Q7180? Inrush limiter transistor that must be told by the ISL6259 that it is safe to allow charger voltage to pass through to the computer. This needs CHGR_AGATE and CHGR_SGATE to be pulled down in order for it to close and allow voltage through to the system, current sensing failures as well as ISL6259 failures can cause this to happen. .

threads.title: [SOLVED]820 3787 - won't turn on with original charger
threads.message:
Hey guy's, 

This board came with a F7005 burned!! I replace that and the machine came life again!! But only work with a Chinese charger 60W,90W ... i have in my store 3 or 4 charger Chinese and all work fine!! With original charger being 60W, 90W i don't have a green light! with a fake charger the battery goes to 100% and work's perfectly!! 

when i plug the original i have only 0.420V in F7005! 

only think i do is replace for a new on <TRANSISTOR>Q7010</TRANSISTOR> and try with another DC-IN! 

suggestions?

threads.title: [SOLVED]820 3787 - won't turn on with original charger
threads.message:
Change <TRANSISTOR>Q7180</TRANSISTOR>.
Original charger detects leakage on the board and doesn't power it up.
Fake chinese charger doesn't have required processor to monitor the leakage current on the start-up...

threads.title: [SOLVED]820 3787 - won't turn on with original charger
threads.message: Ty 2nformaticos!! for help me solve the problem!! and realize what the problem is!!! problem solved!!
